definition: to change profession
to change/to alter/to transform/to correct
row/line/commercial firm/line of business/profession/to rank (first, second etc) among one's siblings (by age)/(in data tables) row/(Tw) column

to walk/to go/to travel/a visit/temporary/makeshift/current/in circulation/to do/to perform/capable/competent/effective/all right/OK!/will do/behavior/conduct/Taiwan pr. [xing4] for the behavior-conduct sense

sentences.english: Many teachers have switched to business because of the temptation of the high returns.
sentences.chinese: 在高薪的利誘之下，許多教師都改行經商了。

sentences.english: And the king said, What honour and dignity hath been done to Mordecai for this?
sentences.chinese: 王說，末底改行了這事，賜他什麼尊榮爵位沒有。

sentences.english: In 1994 I took all these acquired skills, headed in a new direction, and changed careers.
sentences.chinese: 在掌握了所有這些技能後，我於1994年跳槽改行。

sentences.english: After the liberation of Li Luo Huai died, his son diverted, the industry has no mass.
sentences.chinese: 解放後李洛懷過世，其子改行，其業遂不傳。

sentences.english: At first he studied architecture, but later he switched to geology.
sentences.chinese: 他原是學建築的，中途改行搞地質了。

sentences.english: I should have listened to my friends and become an oil producer instead.
sentences.chinese: 看來我早應該聽朋友們的勸告，改行做石油生產商。

sentences.english: After the bleaching ended, the chamber was temporarily sealed for two weeks.
sentences.chinese: 治療結束後，暫時充填髓腔，兩週後改行光固化充填。

sentences.english: Many teachers quit their jobs and go into business under the temptation of high salary .
sentences.chinese: 在高薪的利誘之下，許多教師都改行經商了。

sentences.english: To just become firemen and short-order cooks?
sentences.chinese: 改行當消防員和快餐廚師？

sentences.english: Having said that, shall we all change our careers and become a writer?
sentences.chinese: 這麼說，難道我們要改行成爲作家了嗎？

sentences.english: She was trained as a doctor but diverted to diplomacy.
sentences.chinese: 她是學醫的，但是改行做外交工作了。

sentences.english: This line has four commands in it already. Let's crlf.
sentences.chinese: 這一行裏已經有四個命令句了，改改行吧。

sentences.english: Because of this, Xiao decided not to become an artist, but a director.
sentences.chinese: 正因如此，肖央決定不當畫家改行當導演。

sentences.english: Higher salaries are seducing many teachers into business.
sentences.chinese: 在高薪的利誘之下，許多教師都改行經商了。

definition: to change profession
sideline/side occupation
profession/role (acting)
to switch from one major or faculty to another (at a university)
switch to a job one was not trained for
second job
to totally stop doing something/to reform one's ways
to resume one's old trade (idiom)
one's line/one's own profession
to come off sentry duty/to lay off (a worker)/laid-off
to seek one's livelihood/to work to support oneself/to earn a living
(of a slave or servant) to be given one's freedom/(of a prostitute) to marry and leave one's trade
to go for/to engage in/to undertake/to deal with/to handle/to do
lit. to wash one's hands in a gold basin (idiom)/fig. to abandon the life of an outlaw
to support one's family (idiom); to have difficulty feeding a family
to resign
